intro: Railliardia arborea, commonly known as the tree mallows, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its woody structure and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant features broad, palmate leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Railliardia arborea thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
